citeinfo.title: DC Boundary as defined by Boundary Stones

descript.abstract: District of Columbia boundary. The dataset is a polygon representing the District of Columbia boundary, created as part of the DC Geographic Information System (DC GIS) for the D.C. Office of the Chief Technology Officer (OCTO) and participating D.C. government agencies. The boundary was created by connecting all of the boundary stone locations into a single polygon. All DC GIS data is stored and exported in Maryland State Plane coordinates NAD 83 meters. METADATA CONTENT IS IN PROCESS OF VALIDATION AND SUBJECT TO CHANGE.
descript.purpose: This data is used for the planning and management of Washington, D.C. by local government agencies.

cntorgp.cntorg: D.C. Office of the Chief Technology Officer

idinfo.datacred: Department of Consumer and Regulatory Affairs/Office of the Surveyor
idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 3; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.1.4000

attracc.attraccr: Data believed to be complete and accurate as of the time period cited. Subject to change. Digital version compared with original source data for accuracy and completeness. In process of validation by source and/or responsible agency.

dataqual.logic: In process of validation by source and/or responsible agency.
dataqual.complete: Data believed to be complete and accurate, subject to change. Digital version compared with original source data for accuracy and completeness. In process of validation by source and/or responsible agency.

horizpa.horizpar: Boundary based on monuments placed with Surveyed accuracy is +/- 5cm horizontal and +/- 9cm vertical.

procstep.procdesc: OCTO GIS staff used arcgis desktop to connect all of the boundary stones into three lines covering the north east and west portions of the District. The western boundary of the potomac, acquired from the water layer, was used to complete the boundary. Staff intersected the water and lines at the western most location still in the water but near to Virginia.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

distinfo.custom: Most DC GIS datasets can be downloaded from "http://dcgis.dc.gov" on the data center page. Orders can also be made by contacting OCTO GIS at "dcgis@dc.gov", especially for datasets not available for download.
